div1.head: Photograph of John J. Moran with Dr. and Mrs. Philip Showalter Hench at the false site of Camp Lazear, 1940
div1.p:
This is the false Camp Lazear site. It is
marked as Camp Lazear, but is probably the
site of the Yellow Fever Tent Hospital near
the old Columbia Barracks. Dr. Lazear died
near here in a small hut at the rear of
Camp Columbia.

Site erroneously marked by the Cuban gov't as Camp Lazear-
in reality the place where Dr Lazear died in a small hut
near Camp Columbia.

This is the false Camp Lazear site. It is
marked (by this temporary marker) as Camp
Lazear but it is probably the site of the
Yellow Fever Tent Hospital near the old
Columbia Barracks. The real camp site is
a mile away. It is on this false site that
the authorities (Cuban Gov't) were planning
to build a memorial building to
Dr Lazear et al.

Note the sign intimating
that this is the site of
Camp Lazear.

This is Mr John J Moran (one of first to receive Experimental
Yellow Fever - the first to be bitten in the mosquito bldg at
Camp Lazear). He is in the white suit, with Mary & me.
